title: Confirmed! Gautam Gulati to play former Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri in Azhar
text:
Confirmed! Gautam Gulati to play former Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri in Azhar By Maggie Davis on October 22, 2015 at 6:45 PM Comments The winner of Bigg Boss 8 Gautam Gulati is all set to make his appearance in Bollywood. The handsome hunk would be playing the role of former Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri in Tony D’Souza’s upcoming flick ‘Azhar’ . The biopic is made on former Indian team skipper Mohammad Azharuddin. The news has been confirmed by Gautam himself. According to media reports, the role of Mohammad Azharuddin would be played by Bollywood actor Emraan Hashmi. The Bigg Boss 8 winner said that he is part of the biopic and apart from that he cannot reveal any other details. The biographical sports movie is upon Azharuddin’s involvement in 2000 match-fixing scandal. Apart from the two popular faces (Gautam and Emraan), there would be two leading actresses of B-town who would be playing the role of Azhar’s wife. (ALSO READ: Bigg Boss winner Gautam Gulati is back with Big F) The role of Azharuddin’s two wives Naureen and Sangeeta Bijlani would be played by Prachi Desai and Nargis Fakhri respectively. A source from the film’s unit revealed, “We needed someone relatively new and more importantly, we needed someone who could play cricket well. Gautam fitted the bill. He has not been seen on the big screen. And he’s a good cricketer, so we don’t need to spend time training him for the field,” reports Bollywood Hungama. (ALSO READ: Ravi Shastri : T20 series against South Africa great learning curve for India) Gautam Gulati has also played roles in short films. But he was widely known on small-screen television for his role in the show Diya Aur Baati Hum that was aired on Star Plus. Presently, he is hosting MTV’s show The Big F . (Image Credits – Twitter)
